|Title=Know the definition of "classic" prolonged fever
|Description=≥38°C on several occasions, ≥3 weeks, without diag after appropriate investigations (3 days in hospital or 3 cs)
|Section=Definition
|Contributors=
|Order=1}}
Definition of "classic" prolonged fever '''([[Hyperthermia/fever SD-044|hyperthermia/fever]])'''''

* Occurrence in a subject with no particular medical condition (non-immunocompromised, not hospitalised)
* Temperature (taken at rest) ≥ 38.3°C on several occasions,
* For ≥ 3 weeks,
* No cause identified after appropriate investigations carried out during three days in hospital or after three consultations. There is no pre-established, definitive list of these investigations, which vary according to the clinical context of each patient.


Note: there is no pre-established, definitive list of appropriate investigations (which vary depending on the patient) before making the diagnosis of prolonged fever.

properties.question: What is the definition of 'classic' prolonged fever according to the provided content?
properties.option_a: A fever that persists for 3 days with a temperature of ≥38.3°C in a hospitalized patient.
properties.option_b: A fever that lasts for 3 weeks with a temperature of ≥38.3°C in a non-immunocompromised individual, with no cause identified after three hospital days or consultations.
properties.option_c: A continuous fever for more than 3 weeks in any individual, regardless of the temperature or investigations conducted.
properties.option_d: A fever that lasts exactly 3 weeks, with a temperature of exactly 38°C, and is caused by an identifiable infection.
